meanings.definition: A person who creates graffiti by writing or drawing their name or a symbol in a public place.
meanings.sent1: The taggers left their mark on the wall with colorful spray paint.
meanings.sent2: The city hired a team to clean up graffiti left by taggers.
meanings.sent3: The taggers had a competition to see who could create the most intricate design.
meanings.sent4: The taggers' art transformed the dull alley into a vibrant gallery.
meanings.sent5: The police caught the taggers in the act of defacing the building.

meanings.definition: A tool used to attach one thing to another.
meanings.sent1: She used taggers to fasten the papers together.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter always carries a set of taggers in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The taggers made it easy for him to hang the picture on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The taggers securely held the fabric in place while she sewed.
meanings.sent5: He needed the taggers to connect the wires in the circuit.

meanings.definition: A game in which one player chases and tries to touch another player.
meanings.sent1: The children played taggers in the park, laughing and running around.
meanings.sent2: Taggers is a classic game enjoyed by kids of all ages.
meanings.sent3: During taggers, she tripped and fell, making everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: In taggers, speed and agility are key to avoiding being caught.
meanings.sent5: The taggers game at the party got everyone involved and active.
